alert.note: Alert for Chaves County Plains; Eddy Plains; Lea; Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 26 at 2:22PM MST until February 26 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING FOR SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO... The National Weather Service in Midland/Odessa has issued a Red Flag Warning for relative humidity of 15% or less, 20-ft winds of 20 mph or more, and very high fire danger. * AFFECTED AREA...Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe Mountains, Chaves Plains, Eddy Plains and Lea. * TIMING...Now into the evening. * WINDS...Southwest 40 to 50 mph with gusts up to 70 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...5 to 15 percent. * RFTI...5 or critical. * IMPACTS...Avoid the use of open flames or any activities that may generate sparks. Accidental ignitions may have the potential to grow into dangerous wind-driven wildfires. Ensure that chains attached to trailers will not touch the pavement, thereby eliminating the possibility to generate sparks.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity and warm temperatures will increase potential for fire growth.

area.areaDesc: Chaves County Plains; Eddy Plains; Lea; Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe Mountains
